chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald James Delisi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Ronald James Delisi was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ronald James Delisi is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Ronald James Delisi was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Ronald James Delisi was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Ronald James Delisi was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

supervisions.notes:
Serve 120 days in the Pepin County Jail with work release privileges with credit for 10 days served.  May serve in St. Croix County if at no cost to Pepin County and under rules of Pepin County Sheriff.
Concurrent with: Counts 3 & 4

records.addlTxt: Count 1 - Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

Defendant Ronald James Delisi in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Ronald James Delisi in custody.  Sean Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video conferencing from Pierce County with Judge Boles and Court Reporter Trisha Carlson.  Defendant agrees to proceed by video conferencing for sentencing today.
Sentencing hearing on August 3, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Order Revoking Bond
Day 2
Remanded to the Pepin County Jail.  Sentencing to be scheduled.

Verdict 1 - We the Jury, find the Defendant, Ronald James Delisi, Not Guilty of Second Degree Endangering Safety, as charged in Count One of the Amended Information.
Verdict 4 - We the Jury, find the Defendant, Ronald James Delisi, Guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Injunction, as charged in Count Two of the Amended Information.
Verdict 6 - We the Jury, find the Defendant, Ronald James Delisi, Guilty of Disorderly Conduct, as charged in Count Three of the Amended Information.
Verdict 8 - We the Jury, find the Defendant, Ronald James Delisi, Guilty of Disorderly Conduct, as charged in Count Four of the Amended Information.
Amended Information - Added Count 4 - Disorderly Conduct 947.01(1)
Defendant Ronald James Delisi in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Ronald James Delisi in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing held in Pierce County with all parties present there.  Matter remains unresolved.
State's Proposed Witness List

Final pre-trial at 06-13-2016 02:00 pm.
Jury trial at 07-28-2016 09:00 am.

Jury Trial Scheduling Order:
1.  Trial of this matter is set for jury trial on July 28, 2016.  Time allowed for trial is two days.  Both parties shall be present with their client and ready to go on the record no later than 8:30 a.m. on the morning of trial.
2.  The District Attorney will send the Defense Atty their offer no later than 10 days before the FPT.
3.  The Defense Atty shall review the DA's offer with his client and make a decision whether or not to accept it prior to the FPT.
4.  A FPT is set for June 13, 2016 at 2:00 p.m. in Ellsworth, Wisconsin.  The District Attorney, Defendant and Defense Attorney may appear via phone by calling in to 715-273-6741.  (Attorney ___ should have the Defendant in his office or facilitate a conference call as the Court can only handle two incoming calls).
Failure of the Defendant to appear for the FPT may result in the cancellation of the trial date and a warrant being issued for the Defendant's arrest.
5.  All motions shall be filed in writing within 90 days of this order. ....  Any motions filed will be heard at the time of the FPT on June 13, 2016 at 2:00 p.m. in Ellsworth, Wisconsin.  Notices of alibi and responses shall follow the time limits and other requirements of Sec. 971.23(8) Wis. Stats.
6.  If a resolution of this case is reached prior to the FPT the parties must notify the Court in writing and the FTP will be the Plea hearing.
The State and the Defense shall file and serve no later than 7 days before the FPT:  a.  A list ... witnesses. b.  Any nonstandard substantive or other JI they anticipate they will request be given by the Court.
7.  If the parties enter into plea negotiations or seek a waiver of jury trial after the FPT date they shall state why such matters could not have been resolved prior to the FPT.  If good cause is not provided..., the Court may refuse the resolution or accept the jury waiver.  ...
Failure to comply with SCO may subject the attorney and parties to sanctions allowed in 805.03 Wis. Stats., including but not limited to .......

Counsel to set JT & FPT with Judge Boles judicial assistant and Pepin County.

Defendant Ronald James Delisi in court in Pepin County.   Sean Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin by phone means in Pierce County. Bond with conditions of original bond.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Court advises defendant of charges as stated in the Information, maximum penalties, felony prohibitions, and advises defendant of constitutional rights.  NGP shown.  Any bond conditions remain in effect.  Court notes request for substitution timely even though not in writing, honor request for substitution in writing.  Counsel to take up scheduling with new Judge.

Defendant Ronald James Delisi in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Sworn by the State Officer Ebling. Cross by defense counsel.  Court finds probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  State files Information.  Atty Rivard informs the court not prepared to plea today, recognize his rights to substitution prior to plea.
Preliminary hearing at 08-31-2015 11:00 am

ADDRESS INFO for Ronald James Delisi
Current: 5632 Osgood Ave N, Stillwater, MN 55082 United States  (Effective: 06-02-2015)
Prior: 605 10th Avenue E. Apt A, Durand, WI 54736

Defendant Ronald James Delisi in court with attorney Patrick William Waters of SPD.  Adam Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Waters requests bond modification to allow defendant to return to his home provided no contact with victim.  Atty Sticht informs the court a special prosecutor will be taking over this case.  Defendant requests to have access to his home today and at least once per week.  City Chief of Police agrees to assist defendant to his home today.  Court modifies bond to allow defendant to have access to his home any Thursday from 10 a.m. - 11:00 a.m. and then leave.  Defendant waives time limits for P.H.  Atty Waters informs the court this matter will be assigned out to another attorney.  Parties to see scheduling clerk for continued initial appearance with special prosecutor.  Matter recalled, defendant requests condition be amended to allow him access on Tuesdays from 10-11 instead of Thursdays from 10-11.  Court amends bond as requested.

No contact with S.A. or R.A. or their home or place of employment; 
Cannot be within 20 miles of the City of Durand except to travel to and attend court hearings.

Defendant Ronald James Delisi in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights including right to preliminary hearing within 10 days if in custody, 20 days if not.  State requests $2500 cash bond.  Court inquires where the parties live.  State notes they live 1 house apart.  Court not imposing cash bond, he's always showed up for court, sets $3000.00 Sign. Bond with conditions:  No contact with S.A. or R.A. or their house or place of employment; cannot be within 20 miles of the City of Durand except to travel to and attend court hearings.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
